    • Method Detail

      • load

        public static void load(java.lang.String baseConfigFile,
                        java.lang.String restConfigFile)
        This Method is the entry point to the ConfigLoader. It is used to validate the commandline arguments and check if the given Paths exist. After the configuration is loaded a quick status check is run that determines whether the program is allowed to be further executed.
        Parameters:
        baseConfigFile - Path to dbconnection.properties file
        restConfigFile - Path to the restconnection.properties file

      • assertFilesExist

        private static void assertFilesExist(java.lang.String... paths)
        Checks whether or not the specified files exist. Note that the parameter is a Vararg
        Parameters:
        paths - The paths to the wanted files

      • assertConfigurationStatus

        private static boolean assertConfigurationStatus()
        This method determines whether program gets further executed or not. It takes the list of required properties that should be defined in the configuration file from the ConfigModel Interface and loops through the loaded configuration whilst also checking their types.

        Missing properties get saved to a list which is later used to display the error messages.

        Returns:
        True if the loaded configuration is valid or false otherwise.

      • readConfigurationFile

        private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> readConfigurationFile(java.lang.String path)
        This method parses the configuration file and maps the tokens into a map. A BufferedReader was used because the loaded file is not needed in memory and can be discarded afterwards.

        The query can also contain a path to an external .sql file that contains the query. In that case a new BufferedReader takes care of that.

        All lines that are either empty, do not contain [ = ], or do not have a value assigned to the defined key are ignored.

        Parameters:
        path - The path to the .properties file.
        Returns:
        Returns the mapped
